timeline.message: Fixed double underscore issue on node labels for relTypeProperties

timeline.bodyText: printStackTrace isn't good error handling. Maybe use log.warn to dump the stacetrace and rethrow it wrapped into a RuntimeException
timeline.author: sarmbruster

replies.bodyText: Done - pushed the stacktrace to debug (instead of warn) and wrapped in RuntimeException. As it's something that shouldn't really happen, I thought debug would be better than warn.
replies.author: neoarchitect

timeline.bodyText: same as above on error handling
timeline.author: sarmbruster

replies.bodyText: Done - pushed the stacktrace to debug (instead of warn) and wrapped in RuntimeException. As it's something that shouldn't really happen, I thought debug would be better than warn.
replies.author: neoarchitect

timeline.bodyText: continue is IMO bad practice. Instead use a if (!badCondition) { /* do stuff */ }
timeline.author: sarmbruster

replies.bodyText: I changed it and wrapped the code in an if predicate. I'm not too concerned with continue's usually, but I can see where it could be an issue. Performance wise this might save a few clock cycles too (not really sure)!
replies.author: neoarchitect

timeline.bodyText: I guess it's more concise to use java 8 streams for mapping and sorting?
timeline.author: sarmbruster

replies.bodyText: For minimal changes between 3.5 and 4.0 I didn't change it, but if you think updating this would help, let me know. We're in a bit of a time crunch, so unless critical I'd rather leave it.
replies.author: neoarchitect

timeline.message: Fixed double underscore issue on node labels for relTypeProperties
Changes to error handling, etc, based on code review comments by sarmbruster
Added asciidoc documentation for new procedures
Rewrite of constraint checking mechanism for performance in T4L
